config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'enableAntiAliasing' is a boolean option that determines whether anti-aliasing should be applied to the scaled image. If the option is enabled (true), the scaled image will be processed with anti-aliasing using the OP_ANTIALIAS filter. If the option is disabled (false), no anti-aliasing will be applied.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration 'enableAntiAliasing' is triggered whenever the 'loadPrefs' method is called, which happens when the preferences are loaded. This typically occurs when the application is launched or when the user accesses the preferences/settings.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling anti-aliasing can improve the visual quality of the scaled images by smoothing out jagged edges and reducing pixelation. However, applying anti-aliasing can also increase the processing time and memory usage, especially for larger images or when processing a large number of images. Therefore, enabling anti-aliasing may have a performance impact on the system, particularly in terms of processing speed and memory consumption.
